adverbs.description: morbidly (comparative more morbidly, superlative most morbidly)

entries.meaning: In a morbid manner, or to a morbid degree.
examples: In his reply he seemed less set against that plan than his past attitude would have led one to predict, but said he would like to hold off a little while longer—long enough to get his things in order and reconcile himself to the idea of leaving an almost morbidly cherished birthplace.
